definition: the part of a tooth that is embedded in the jaw and serves as support, take root and begin to grow
details:
noun
- the part of a tooth that is embedded in the jaw and serves as support
= synonyms: tooth root
- (linguistics) the form of a word after all affixes are removed
= synonyms: stem
- a simple form inferred as the common basis from which related words in several languages can be derived by linguistic processes
= synonyms: etymon
- the set of values that give a true statement when substituted into an equation
= synonyms: solution
- the place where something begins, where it springs into being
= synonyms: beginning
- someone from whom you are descended (but usually more remote than a grandparent)
= synonyms: antecedent
- (botany) the usually underground organ that lacks buds or leaves or nodes
- a number that, when multiplied by itself some number of times, equals a given number
verb
- take root and begin to grow
= example: take root and begin to grow
- cause to take roots
- become settled or established and stable in one's residence or life style
= synonyms: settle
- dig with the snout
= example: dig with the snout
= synonyms: rout, rootle
- plant by the roots
- come into existence, originate
= example: come into existence, originate
